issue.title: Negative value returned for track's number of data points

content.raw:
I ran the same data set (that I received offline) and I got the following results:
[  34617866 2565500676   31776113    2057636]

Presumably this bug comes from using an older version of the software, or it is a bug that I simply cannot reproduce.

Also of note the max signed 32 bit value would be, 2147483647 which would cause an overflow of 418017029. The minimum value for an 32 bit signed int is -2147483648 which when adding the overflow comes out to -1729466619. This is most definitely an overflow bug that has been fixed by either genomedata or one of its dependencies at some point.

I ran the same data set (that I received offline) and I got the following results: [ 34617866 2565500676 31776113 2057636]

Presumably this bug comes from using an older version of the software, or it is a bug that I simply cannot reproduce.

Also of note the max signed 32 bit value would be, 2147483647 which would cause an overflow of 418017029. The minimum value for an 32 bit signed int is -2147483648 which when adding the overflow comes out to -1729466619. This is most definitely an overflow bug that has been fixed by either genomedata or one of its dependencies at some point.
